page.title: 17Home Life
page.content: Most homes are owner occupied, several are used as second homes or holiday cottages. Proportion of elderly people has increased significantly in recent years with younger family members seeking employment elsewhere. Traditional open fireplaces have been sealed for installation of Rayburns and wood burning stoves. Several newcomers have restored original character of homes. People who have always lived in area still have 4 meals a day and traditional sunday lunch . Cawl has retaind its popularity. Local speciality is Gwledd Y Cybydd (Misers Feats) sliced potatoes, onions and bacon, cooked in an open fire. Bara Planc (unleavened bread baked on bakestone) Pice ar y maen (Welsh cakes) and Tarten ar y Maen (griddle tart) also very popular.
